thread.title: Aussie pop superstar Conrad Sewell: ‘I want to steal One Direction’s fans’
thread.title_full: Aussie pop superstar Conrad Sewell: ‘I want to steal One Direction’s fans’

title: Aussie pop superstar Conrad Sewell: ‘I want to steal One Direction’s fans’
text:
England , he says, “has always been a second home”. 
“It’s a very important place for me and especially to put my music out because finally my English side of my family get to hear stuff and finally think I’m doing something with me life,” he jokes. 
Having unsuccessfully auditioned for season two of Australian Idol, he moved back here at 18 to record a demo. “Trust me, I had a lot of fun while I was doing it. I was seeing the world, meeting pretty girls and living life, and I was making music while I was doing it,” he says, before anyone begins to feel too sorry for him. Jess Glynne (Omar Vega/AP) 
Now, nine years later, he’s returned to support girl of the moment Jess Glynne on tour. Although it’s a shared record label that’s made this union happen, Conrad would much rather believe it was serendipity. 
“I met her once going on a plane going to Paris or Spain . I didn’t realise who she was and I talked to her as she was getting on the plane. 
“It was only later when I saw her on TV that I realised it was Jess that I was just talking to. She was pretty big at that time, Rather Be was out, I just didn’t know what she looked like,” he said. 
He’ll know the flame-haired singer’s face well enough after the tour. 
“I can’t wait to hang out with her again and get to know her, she seems like such a great girl. She’s got such a sick voice,” he enthuses. Share article 
His “impressive vocals” (his words) will arrive on a debut album next year; until then, you’ll have to get your hands on the gold dust tickets for Jess’ gigs. Promoted Stories
